<h1 id="comprehensive-notes-on-statistics-and-probability-theory">Comprehensive Notes on Statistics and Probability Theory</h1>
<p>This document provides a detailed overview of fundamental concepts in Statistics and Probability Theory. It covers definitions, essential formulas, and illustrative examples for each topic.</p>
<h2 id="importance-of-statistics-and-probability-theory">1. Importance of Statistics and Probability Theory</h2>
<p>Statistics and Probability Theory are indispensable disciplines that provide the mathematical framework for dealing with uncertainty and making sense of data. They are crucial for:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Data Analysis:</strong> Transforming raw data into meaningful information and actionable insights.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Decision Making:</strong> Providing a rigorous basis for making informed decisions under conditions of uncertainty in business, science, engineering, and policy.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Risk Assessment:</strong> Quantifying and managing risks in finance, insurance, and project management.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Scientific Research:</strong> Designing experiments, analyzing results, and drawing valid conclusions.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Predictive Modeling:</strong> Building models to forecast future trends and outcomes (e.g., weather, stock prices, disease spread).</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Quality Control:</strong> Monitoring processes and ensuring product quality.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="samples-vs.-populations">2. Samples vs. Populations</h2>
<p>Understanding the distinction between a sample and a population is fundamental to statistical inference.</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Population:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Definition:</strong> The entire group of individuals, objects, or data points about which information is desired or conclusions are to be drawn. It represents the complete set of possible observations.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Characteristics:</strong> Often very large, potentially infinite, and usually impractical or impossible to observe in its entirety.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Parameters:</strong> Numerical descriptors of a population. These are typically unknown fixed values that we try to estimate (e.g., population mean <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mu</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.625em; vertical-align: -0.19444em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">μ</span></span></span></span></span>, population standard deviation <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>σ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\sigma</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">σ</span></span></span></span></span>, population proportion <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">p</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.625em; vertical-align: -0.19444em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">p</span></span></span></span></span>).</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> All registered voters in a country; all manufactured light bulbs from a specific production line.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Sample:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Definition:</strong> A subset of the population that is selected for observation and analysis.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Characteristics:</strong> A manageable, finite group from which data are collected.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Statistics:</strong> Numerical descriptors calculated from sample data. These are known values used to estimate unknown population parameters (e.g., sample mean <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mover accent="true"><mi>x</mi><mo>ˉ</mo></mover></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\bar{x}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.56778em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord accent"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.56778em;"><span class="" style="top: -3em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span></span><span class="" style="top: -3em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="accent-body" style="left: -0.22222em;"><span class="mord">ˉ</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>, sample standard deviation <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">s</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">s</span></span></span></span></span>, sample proportion <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mover accent="true"><mi>p</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\hat{p}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.88888em; vertical-align: -0.19444em;"></span><span class="mord accent"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.69444em;"><span class="" style="top: -3em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">p</span></span><span class="" style="top: -3em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="accent-body" style="left: -0.16666em;"><span class="mord">^</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.19444em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>).</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> 1,000 randomly selected registered voters; a batch of 100 light bulbs tested from the production line.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Statistical Inference:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>The process of using information obtained from a sample to make generalizations, predictions, or decisions about the larger population from which the sample was drawn.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="measures-and-scales-of-measurement">3. Measures and Scales of Measurement</h2>
<p>Scales of measurement describe the nature and properties of the numerical values assigned to variables. They determine the types of statistical analyses that are appropriate.</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Nominal Scale:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Definition:</strong> Categorical data where values are labels or names that categorize attributes without any inherent order or ranking.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Properties:</strong> Only distinguishes between categories.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Gender (Male, Female, Non-binary), Eye Color (Blue, Brown, Green), Type of Car (Sedan, SUV, Truck).</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Applicable Operations/Statistics:</strong> Counting frequencies, percentages, mode.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>No meaningful mathematical operations (addition, subtraction, etc.).</strong></p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Ordinal Scale:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Definition:</strong> Categorical data where values have a meaningful order or ranking, but the intervals between ranks are not necessarily equal or meaningful.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Properties:</strong> Establishes a relative order.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Education Level (High School, Bachelor’s, Master’s, PhD), Likert Scale (Strongly Disagree, Disagree, Neutral, Agree, Strongly Agree), Military Ranks.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Applicable Operations/Statistics:</strong> All nominal operations, plus median, ranks.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Intervals between values are not quantifiable.</strong></p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Interval Scale:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Definition:</strong> Numerical data where values have a meaningful order, and the intervals between successive values are equal and meaningful. However, there is no true or absolute zero point (zero does not indicate the absence of the quantity).</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Properties:</strong> Allows for addition and subtraction.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Temperature in Celsius (<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msup><mn>0</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">0^\circ C</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.674115em;"><span class="" style="top: -3.063em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mbin mtight">∘</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.07153em;">C</span></span></span></span></span> does not mean absence of heat), Calendar Years (Year 0 is arbitrary, not the absence of time).</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Applicable Operations/Statistics:</strong> All nominal and ordinal operations, plus mean, standard deviation, correlation.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Ratio comparisons are not meaningful (e.g.,</strong> <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mn>0</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">20^\circ C</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">2</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.674115em;"><span class="" style="top: -3.063em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mbin mtight">∘</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.07153em;">C</span></span></span></span></span> <strong>is not twice as hot as</strong> <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>1</mn><msup><mn>0</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">10^\circ C</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">1</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.674115em;"><span class="" style="top: -3.063em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mbin mtight">∘</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.07153em;">C</span></span></span></span></span><strong>).</strong></p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Ratio Scale:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Definition:</strong> Numerical data where values have a meaningful order, equal intervals between values, and a true or absolute zero point (zero indicates the complete absence of the quantity being measured).</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Properties:</strong> Allows for all mathematical operations, including multiplication and division.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Height, Weight, Age, Income, Number of items sold, Time (duration).</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Applicable Operations/Statistics:</strong> All statistical operations are appropriate.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Ratio comparisons are meaningful (e.g., 20 kg is twice as heavy as 10 kg).</strong></p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="random-experiments-and-probabilities">4. Random Experiments and Probabilities</h2>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Random Experiment:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Definition:</strong> A process or action with an uncertain outcome, but where all possible outcomes are known in advance. It can be repeated under identical conditions.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Characteristics:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>All possible outcomes are identifiable.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The actual outcome cannot be predicted with certainty.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Can be repeated multiple times.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Flipping a coin, rolling a die, drawing a card from a well-shuffled deck, observing the gender of a newborn baby, measuring the lifespan of a light bulb.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Outcome:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Definition:</strong> A single result of a random experiment.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> When rolling a 6-sided die, ‘3’ is an outcome.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Sample Space (</strong><span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\Omega</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">Ω</span></span></span></span></span> <strong>or</strong> <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">S</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05764em;">S</span></span></span></span></span><strong>):</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Definition:</strong> The set of all possible outcomes of a random experiment.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Flipping a coin: <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>H</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>d</mi><mo separator="true">,</mo><mi>T</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\Omega = {Head, Tail}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">Ω</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.88888em; vertical-align: -0.19444em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">He</span><span class="mord mathnormal">a</span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">T</span><span class="mord mathnormal">ai</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.01968em;">l</span></span></span></span></span></span></p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Rolling a 6-sided die: <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>2</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>5</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\Omega = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">Ω</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83888em; vertical-align: -0.19444em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">1</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord">2</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord">3</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord">4</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord">5</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord">6</span></span></span></span></span></span></p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Flipping two coins: <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>H</mi><mi>H</mi><mo separator="true">,</mo><mi>H</mi><mi>T</mi><mo separator="true">,</mo><mi>T</mi><mi>H</mi><mo separator="true">,</mo><mi>T</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\Omega = {HH, HT, TH, TT}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">Ω</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.87777em; vertical-align: -0.19444em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">HH</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">T</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">T</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">TT</span></span></span></span></span></span></p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Event:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Definition:</strong> A subset of the sample space; a collection of one or more outcomes. An event occurs if any of its constituent outcomes occurs.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Getting an even number on a die roll: <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">E = {2, 4, 6}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05764em;">E</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83888em; vertical-align: -0.19444em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">2</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord">4</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord">6</span></span></span></span></span></span></p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Getting at least one Head in two coin flips: <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>H</mi><mi>T</mi><mo separator="true">,</mo><mi>T</mi><mi>H</mi><mo separator="true">,</mo><mi>H</mi><mi>H</mi></mrow></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">E = {HT, TH, HH}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05764em;">E</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.87777em; vertical-align: -0.19444em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">T</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">T</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">HH</span></span></span></span></span></span></p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Probability:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Definition:</strong> A numerical measure of the likelihood or chance that an event will occur. Probabilities are always between 0 and 1, inclusive.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Axioms of Probability (Kolmogorov Axioms):</strong></p>
<ol>
<li>
<p>For any event <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">A</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span></span></span></span></span>, <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>≤</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">0 \le P(A) \le 1</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.78041em; vertical-align: -0.13597em;"></span><span class="mord">0</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">≤</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">≤</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">1</span></span></span></span></span>.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The probability of the sample space (the sure event) is 1: <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(\Omega) = 1</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord">Ω</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">1</span></span></span></span></span>.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>If <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo separator="true">,</mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo separator="true">,</mo><mo>…</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">A_1, A_2, \dots</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.87777em; vertical-align: -0.19444em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.301108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.301108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="minner">…</span></span></span></span></span> are a sequence of mutually exclusive (disjoint) events, then:</p>
<p><span class="katex--display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>∪</mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>∪</mo><mo>…</mo> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mo>…</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(A_1 \cup A_2 \cup \dots) = P(A_1) + P(A_2) + \dots</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.301108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">∪</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83333em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.301108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">∪</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; </li>

</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Basic Probability Rules:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Complement Rule:</strong> The probability that an event <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">A</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span></span></span></span></span> does not occur, denoted as <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msup><mi>A</mi><mi>c</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">A^c</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.664392em;"><span class="" style="top: -3.063em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">c</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> or <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msup><mi>A</mi><mo mathvariant="normal" lspace="0em" rspace="0em">′</mo></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">A'</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.751892em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.751892em;"><span class="" style="top: -3.063em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">′</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>, is:</p>
<p><span class="katex--display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mi>A</mi><mi>c</mi></msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(A^c) = 1 - P(A)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.714392em;"><span class="" style="top: -3.113em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">c</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.72777em; vertical-align: -0.08333em;"></span><span class="mord">1</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span></span></p>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> If <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>rain</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0.3</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(\text{rain}) = 0.3</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">rain</span></span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">0.3</span></span></span></span></span>, then <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>no&nbsp;rain</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.3</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0.7</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(\text{no rain}) = 1 - 0.3 = 0.7</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">no&nbsp;rain</span></span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.72777em; vertical-align: -0.08333em;"></span><span class="mord">1</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">0.3</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">0.7</span></span></span></span></span>.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Addition Rule for Any Two Events</strong> <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">A</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span></span></span></span></span> <strong>and</strong> <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">B</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span></span></span></span></span><strong>:</strong></p>
<p><span class="katex--display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>∪</mo><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>∩</mo><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(A \cup B) = P(A) + P(B) - P(A \cap B)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">∪</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">∩</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span></span></p>
<p>Where <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>∩</mo><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(A \cap B)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">∩</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span> is the probability that both <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">A</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span></span></span></span></span> and <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">B</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span></span></span></span></span> occur.<br>
<strong>Example:</strong> If <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>passing&nbsp;Math</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0.7</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(\text{passing Math}) = 0.7</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">passing&nbsp;Math</span></span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">0.7</span></span></span></span></span>, <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>passing&nbsp;Physics</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0.6</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(\text{passing Physics}) = 0.6</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">passing&nbsp;Physics</span></span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">0.6</span></span></span></span></span>, and <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>passing&nbsp;both</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0.5</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(\text{passing both}) = 0.5</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">passing&nbsp;both</span></span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">0.5</span></span></span></span></span>, then <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>passing&nbsp;at&nbsp;least&nbsp;one</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0.7</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>0.6</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0.8</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(\text{passing at least one}) = 0.7 + 0.6 - 0.5 = 0.8</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.08333em;"></span><span class="mord">0.7</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.72777em; </li>
<li>

vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">∩</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.80556em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">0</span></span></span></span></span>, so:</p>
<p><span class="katex--display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>∪</mo><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(A \cup B) = P(A) + P(B)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">∪</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span></span></p>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> Rolling a die, <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>even</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0.5</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(\text{even}) = 0.5</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">even</span></span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">0.5</span></span></span></span></span>, <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>odd</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0.5</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(\text{odd}) = 0.5</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">0.5</span></span></span></span></span>. These are mutually exclusive. <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>even&nbsp;or&nbsp;odd</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0.5</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>0.5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(\text{even or odd}) = 0.5 + 0.5 = 1</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">even&nbsp;or&nbsp;odd</span></span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.72777em; vertical-align: -0.08333em;"></span><span class="mord">0.5</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">0.5</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">1</span></span></span></span></span>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="types-of-probability">5. Types of Probability</h2>
<p>Probabilities can be interpreted and determined in different ways:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Classical Probability (A Priori Probability):</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Definition:</strong> Based on formal reasoning and the assumption that all outcomes in the sample space are equally likely. It can be determined before any experiment is conducted.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Formula:</strong></p>
<p><span class="katex--display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mtext>Number&nbsp;of&nbsp;favorable&nbsp;outcomes&nbsp;for&nbsp;A</mtext><mtext>Total&nbsp;number&nbsp;of&nbsp;equally&nbsp;likely&nbsp;outcomes&nbsp;in&nbsp;the&nbsp;sample&nbsp;space</mtext></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(A) = \frac{\text{Number of favorable outcomes for A}}{\text{Total number of equally likely outcomes in the sample space}}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.25188em; vertical-align: -0.88044em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.37144em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Total&nbsp;number&nbsp;of&nbsp;equally&nbsp;likely&nbsp;outcomes&nbsp;in&nbsp;the&nbsp;sample&nbsp;space</span></span></span></span><span class="" style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span class="" style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Number&nbsp;of&nbsp;favorable&nbsp;outcomes&nbsp;for&nbsp;A</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.88044em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> The probability of rolling a ‘4’ on a fair six-sided die is <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>6</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\frac{1}{6}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.19011em; vertical-align: -0.345em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.845108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">6</span></span></span></span><span class="" style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span class="" style="top: -3.394em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.345em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span></span></span>, because there is 1 favorable outcome and 6 equally likely total outcomes.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Limitations:</strong> Only applicable when outcomes are truly equally likely.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Empirical Probability (A Posteriori Probability / Relative Frequency):</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Definition:</strong> Based on actual observations from repeatedly performing an experiment. It is the ratio of the number of times an event occurs to the total number of trials.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Formula:</strong></p>
<p><span class="katex--display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mtext>Number&nbsp;of&nbsp;times&nbsp;event&nbsp;A&nbsp;occurred</mtext><mtext>Total&nbsp;number&nbsp;of&nbsp;trials</mtext></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(A) = \frac{\text{Number of times event A occurred}}{\text{Total number of trials}}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.05744em; vertical-align: -0.686em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.37144em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Total&nbsp;number&nbsp;of&nbsp;trials</span></span></span></span><span class="" style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span class="" style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Number&nbsp;of&nbsp;times&nbsp;event&nbsp;A&nbsp;occurred</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.686em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> If a biased coin is flipped 100 times and lands on heads 60 times, the empirical probability of heads is <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mn>60</mn><mn>100</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.6</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\frac{60}{100} = 0.6</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.19011em; vertical-align: -0.345em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.845108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">100</span></span></span></span><span class="" style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span class="" style="top: -3.394em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">60</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.345em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">0.6</span></span></span></span></span>. As the number of trials increases, the empirical probability tends to approach the true probability (Law of Large Numbers).</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Limitations:</strong> Depends on the number of trials and can vary with different sets of trials.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Subjective Probability:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Definition:</strong> Based on personal judgment, intuition, experience, or expertise, especially when objective data is scarce or impossible to collect.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> A doctor’s assessment of the probability that a patient will recover from a rare disease; a sports analyst’s prediction of a team winning a championship.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Limitations:</strong> Highly personal and can vary significantly between individuals. Not based on mathematical calculation or observed frequencies.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="conditional-probability">6. Conditional Probability</h2>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Definition:</strong> The probability of an event occurring, given that another event has already occurred or is known to have occurred. It reflects how the occurrence of one event modifies the likelihood of another.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Notation:</strong> <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(A|B)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mord">∣</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span> is read as “the probability of event A given event B.”</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Formula:</strong></p>
<p><span class="katex--display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>∩</mo><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo separator="true">,</mo><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mtext>provided&nbsp;</mtext><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>&gt;</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(A|B) = \frac{P(A \cap B)}{P(B)}, \quad \text{provided } P(B) &gt; 0</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mord">∣</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.363em; vertical-align: class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span><span class="" style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.936em;"><span class="mord">0</span></span></span></span></span></span></p>
<p>Where:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>∩</mo><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(A \cap B)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">∩</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span> is the joint probability that both event <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">A</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span></span></span></span></span> and event <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">B</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span></span></span></span></span> occur.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(B)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span> is the marginal probability of event <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">B</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span></span></span></span></span>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Multiplication Rule (derived from conditional probability):</strong></p>
<p><span class="katex--display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>∩</mo><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(A \cap B) = P(A|B) \cdot P(B)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">∩</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span></span></p>
<p>or equivalently:</p>
<p><span class="katex--display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>∩</mo><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><mi>A</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(A \cap B) = P(B|A) \cdot P(A)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; </li>
<li>
<p><strong>Example:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Consider a deck of 52 playing cards.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Let <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">A</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span></span></span></span></span> be the event “drawing a King.”</p>

<li>
<p>Let <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">B</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68333em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span></span></span></span></span> be the event “drawing a Face Card (King, Queen, Jack).”</p>

</li>
<li>

</li>
<li>
<p><span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>∩</mo><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(A \cap B)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span>: The event of drawing a King AND a Face Card is just drawing a King, so <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>∩</mo><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>52</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(A \cap B) = P(A) = \frac{4}{52}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">∩</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.19011em; vertical-align: -0.345em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.845108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">52</span></span></span></span><span class="" style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span class="" style="top: -3.394em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">4</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.345em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span></span></span>.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Now, <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(A|B)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mord">∣</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05017em;">B</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span> = Probability of drawing a King GIVEN that you drew a Face Card.</p>
<p><span class="katex--display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>∩</mo><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mn>52</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mn>52</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>12</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(A|B) = \frac{P(A \cap B)}{P(B)} = \frac{4/52}{12/52} = \frac{4}{12} = \frac{1}{3}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em;
